BadRequest.description: The request failed could not authenticate, but the token existed.

Forbidden.description: The API key doesn't have permissions to perform the request.

InternalServerError.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

NotAcceptable.description: The request was unacceptable, often due to missing a required parameter.

created_at.description: The date and time the session/request was created.

ip_address.description: The IP address the request originated from.

completed_at.description: The date and time the file conversion was completed.

created_at.description: The date and time the file conversion was created.

id.description: The id of the file conversion.

status.description: The status of the file conversion.

cpu_platform.description: The CPU platform of the instance.

git_hash.description: The git hash of the code the server was built from.

image.description: The image that was used as the base of the instance.

ip_address.description: The IP address of the instance.

machine_type.description: The machine type of the instance.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the KittyCAD API.

x-python.client:
from kittycad import AuthenticatedClient

# Create a client with your token.
client = AuthenticatedClient(token="$TOKEN")

get.description: Get information about this specific API server instance. This is primarily used for debugging.

200.description: Returns the instance metadata if successful.

x-python.example:
from kittycad.models import InstanceMetadata
from kittycad.api.meta import meta_debug_instance
from kittycad.types import Response

instance: InstanceMetadata = meta_debug_instance.sync(client=client)

# OR if you need more info (e.g. status_code)
response: Response[InstanceMetadata] = meta_debug_instance.sync_detailed(client=client)
# OR run async
instance: InstanceMetadata = await meta_debug_instance.asyncio(client=client)

# OR run async with more info
response: Response[InstanceMetadata] = await meta_debug_instance.asyncio_detailed(client=client)

get.description: Get information about your API request session. This is primarily used for debugging.

200.description: Returns the authorized user's authentication session if successful.

x-python.example:
from kittycad.models import AuthSession
from kittycad.api.meta import meta_debug_session
from kittycad.types import Response

session: AuthSession = meta_debug_session.sync(client=client)

# OR if you need more info (e.g. status_code)
response: Response[AuthSession] = meta_debug_session.sync_detailed(client=client)

# OR run async
session: AuthSession = await meta_debug_session.asyncio(client=client)

# OR run async with more info
response: Response[AuthSession] = await meta_debug_session.asyncio_detailed(client=client)

get.description: Get the status and output of an async file conversion.

parameters.description: The id of the file conversion.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Returns the status of the file conversion. If completed, the contents of the converted file will be returned as a base64 encoded string.

x-python.example:
from kittycad.models import FileConversion
from kittycad.api.file import file_conversion_by_id_with_base64_helper
from kittycad.types import Response

fc: FileConversion = file_conversion_by_id_with_base64_helper.sync(client=client, id="<uuid_of_your_conversion>")

# OR if you need more info (e.g. status_code)
response: Response[FileConversion] = file_conversion_by_id_with_base64_helper.sync_detailed(client=client, id="<uuid_of_your_conversion>")

# OR run async
fc: FileConversion = await file_conversion_by_id_with_base64_helper.asyncio(client=client, id="<uuid_of_your_conversion>")

# OR run async with more info
response: Response[FileConversion] = await file_conversion_by_id_with_base64_helper.asyncio_detailed(client=client, id="<uuid_of_your_conversion>")

post.description: Convert a CAD file from one format to another. If the file being converted is larger than 30mb, it will be performed asynchronously.

parameters.description: The format of the file to convert.
parameters.name: sourceFormat

parameters.description: The format the file should be converted to.
parameters.name: outputFormat

requestBody.description: The content of the file to convert, base64 encoded.

200.description: Returns the contents of the converted file, base64 encoded, if successful.

202.description: The file conversion is being performed asynchronously. You can use the `id` returned from the request to poll for status information about the conversion.

x-python.example:
from kittycad.models import FileConversion, ValidFileType
from kittycad.api.file import file_convert_with_base64_helper
from kittycad.types import Response

# Convert a file from STL to OBJ.
# Read in the contents of the file.
file = open("example.stl", "rb")
content = file.read()
file.close()

fc: FileConversion = file_convert_with_base64_helper.sync(client=client, content=content, source_format=ValidFileType.STL, output_format=ValidFileType.OBJ)

# OR if you need more info (e.g. status_code)
response: Response[FileConversion] = file_convert_with_base64_helper.sync_detailed(client=client, content=content, source_format=ValidFileType.STL, output_format=ValidFileType.OBJ)

# OR run async
fc: FileConversion = await file_convert_with_base64_helper.asyncio(client=client, content=content, source_format=ValidFileType.STL, output_format=ValidFileType.OBJ)

# OR run async with more info
response: Response[FileConversion] = await file_convert_with_base64_helper.asyncio_detailed(client=client, content=content, source_format=ValidFileType.STL, output_format=ValidFileType.OBJ)

from kittycad.models import Message
from kittycad.api.meta import ping
from kittycad.types import Response

instance: Message = ping.sync(client=client)

# OR if you need more info (e.g. status_code)
response: Response[Message] = ping.sync_detailed(client=client)
# OR run async
instance: Message = await ping.asyncio(client=client)

# OR run async with more info
response: Response[Message] = await ping.asyncio_detailed(client=client)

tags.description: Meta information about servers, instances, and sessions.
tags.name: meta
